H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2183.def: = action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness

H5005.def: = action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their husband or wife; ≈ often used as a metaphor for idolatry

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

20.gl: to place (in a position) > to appoint

31.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H6174.def: = state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame

H3322.def: = causative action by which humans place other humans or objects in a certain location

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6723.def: = state in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert-like conditions

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H2183.def: = action by which humans engage in prostitution; ≈ associated with unfaithfulness

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H2029.def: = process by which someone becomes pregnant

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6785.def: = soft wavy undercoat of hairy animals such as sheep, ► used to weave a fabric from which clothing was made; ≈ associated with whiteness, purity, and softness

H6593.def: = product of a plant of about a meter tall; its leaves are narrow and the flowers are bright blue with five petals; ► the seed capsule contains oil; after the plants have ripened they are uprooted and the stalks are left to dry for a while; they are then soaked, dried, and beaten to separate the fibers, which are then combed and woven into linen cloth

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H8250.def: = a liquid for humans to drink

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1443.def: = causative action by which someone builds or repairs a wall, often made of natural stones; ≈ such a wall is sometimes used to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H1447.def: = a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H8492.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well-being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H3323.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food and in various religious rituals

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1168.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5040.def: = genitals of a woman; ≈ cause of shame when exposed in public

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7673.def: = process by which an activity comes to an end

H4885.def: poetic term; = state in which humans, deities, and animals feel and show great joy

H2282.def: = celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H7676.def: = the seventh day of the week, which is a day of rest during which the people are not to do any work

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2484.def: = object made by an artist; ◄ made out of a precious metal, with or without precious stones; ► worn for personal adornment; ≈ regarded as valuable and beautiful

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H5911.def: = valley; ◄ located on northern border of territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► place where {L:Achan<SDBH:עָכָן>}, who "caused trouble for Israel" was stoned and buried; ≈ therefore associated with trouble and punishment

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7431.def: = a general term for small animals with short or no legs

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H781.def: = action by which a man makes a marriage contract by means of the payment of a bride-price with the family of a woman, which is usually done before the man takes the woman to live with him

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
